subject: Re: Help,what's wrong with my TDD practice in my daily life?
msgSnippet: ... But sometimes I am confused with the idea to do the simplest thing that can possibly work . I lost my judgement on what is the simplest thing that can
messageBody:
"CÃ©dric Beust â"" wrote:
>
> True, but I've also seen quite a few examples where TDD-written
> classes led to micro-design that forced a lot of refactoring to be
> made later as the complexity of the software grows. In particular,
> the idea to "do the simplest thing that can possibly work" can be
> dangerous, because sometimes, you just know where your code is going
> and it's safe to start doing things that might not necessarily be the
> simplest thing at the moment but that will save you time in the near
> future.

But sometimes I am confused with the idea to "do the simplest thing
that can possibly work". I lost my judgement on what is the simplest
thing that can possibly work,just as mentioned in this discussion.

How to get good judgement?I think I no choice but more and more
learning and practice.

Thanks.
